Catalogue of Open Research Practices in the Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences

Catalogue > Practices

Practices are ways of doing, thinking, or making that shape how knowledge is produced and shared. They emerge as much through habit, collaboration, and context as from set rules, disciplines, or institutional expectations. This catalogue was created in 2025-6 as part of the MORPHSS (Materialising Open Research in the Humanities and Social Sciences) research project. It is designed as a living, iterative, and collaborative showcase of open research practices within the arts, humanities, and social sciences disciplines.
